ðŸ”¥ WallMod | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Wallpaper browsing, management, and modification using local image files.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Loads images from directories (png/jpg/jpeg/bmp) â€¢ Image resizing and layout management â€¢ Wallpaper preview on multiple monitors â€¢ Area selection for background setting â€¢ Image filtering and sorting
ðŸ“– Summary: WallMod is a wallpaper browser and manager that allows users to utilize their own image files as wallpapers. It offers features such as image loading, resizing, filtering, and area selection for setting backgrounds on multiple monitors. The application does not run in the background, setting wallpapers natively and prioritizing low memory consumption.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ YoutubeGO | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading YouTube videos and playlists for offline use in MP3 and MP4 formats.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-Platform Support for HTTP streams â€¢ Playlist Downloads â€¢ MP4 and MP3 format support â€¢ High-Resolution Support (up to 8K) â€¢ Batch Processing
ðŸ“– Summary: YoutubeGO is a Python-based multimedia downloader designed for saving YouTube content. It supports downloading videos and playlists in various formats, including MP3 and MP4, with resolutions up to 8K. The application features a user-friendly interface with drag-and-drop support, profile management, a download scheduler, and cross-platform compatibility.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ HealthyBatteryCharging | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Prolonging the battery life of Android phones by encouraging users to keep the battery charge between 40% and 80%.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Notifies users when to plug/unplug phone to maintain battery between 40% and 80% â€¢ Optimized for low battery consumption â€¢ Runs in the background
ðŸ“– Summary: Healthy Battery Charging is an Android application designed to extend the lifespan of your phone's battery. It achieves this by notifying users when to plug in or unplug their device, aiming to keep the battery charge within the optimal range of 40% to 80%. The app runs in the background with minimal battery consumption, checking the battery level periodically.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ GPU-Puzzles | Jupyter Notebook
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Learning CUDA programming through interactive puzzles.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Interactive GPU programming tutorials â€¢ Uses NUMBA to map Python code to CUDA kernels â€¢ Focuses on practical coding exercises â€¢ Teaches fundamental GPU algorithms for deep learning
ðŸ“– Summary: The GPU-Puzzles repository provides interactive Jupyter Notebook tutorials for learning CUDA programming. It uses NUMBA to translate Python code into CUDA kernels, offering a hands-on approach to understanding GPU algorithms. The puzzles are designed to teach the basics of GPU programming and the algorithms that power deep learning.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ glim | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Versatile and extensible range-based 3D localization and mapping framework.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Accuracy through direct multi-scan registration error minimization on factor graphs â€¢ GPU acceleration for maximizing mapping speed and quality â€¢ Interactive map correction interface for manual refinement â€¢ Versatility across various range sensors (LiDAR, RGB-D)
ðŸ“– Summary: GLIM is a versatile C++ framework for 3D localization and mapping, designed for accuracy and extensibility. It supports various range sensors, including LiDAR and RGB-D cameras, and offers GPU acceleration for performance. The framework also provides an interactive interface for map correction and a callback mechanism for extending functionality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ kdenlive | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Video editing
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Free and Open Source video editing â€¢ Based on MLT Framework â€¢ Based on KDE Frameworks 6 â€¢ Nightly builds available for Linux, Windows, and macOS â€¢ Merge request submission on KDE GitLab
ðŸ“– Summary: Kdenlive is a free and open-source video editing application built upon the MLT Framework and KDE Frameworks. It offers a range of features for video editing and provides nightly builds for various operating systems. Contributions are welcomed through merge requests on the KDE GitLab platform.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ yt-channel-downloader | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading multiple videos from YouTube channels easily using a GUI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Downloads multiple videos from YouTube channels at once â€¢ Uses yt-dlp, scrapetube, and pytube for downloading â€¢ Provides a PyQt 6 GUI for a seamless user experience â€¢ Supports YouTube login for private/age-restricted content
ðŸ“– Summary: YT Channel Downloader is a desktop application that simplifies downloading multiple videos from YouTube channels. It leverages yt-dlp, scrapetube, and pytube, and features a PyQt 6 GUI for a user-friendly experience. The application supports features like YouTube login, thumbnail downloads, and FFmpeg installation verification, making it a comprehensive tool for downloading YouTube content.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ghoulbond | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: System utility, scanning, and OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) tool.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ System Information Gathering â€¢ IP and MAC Address Retrieval â€¢ Wifi Password Recovery â€¢ Email Scraping from Websites â€¢ Port Scanning (Single and Multiple Targets, Deep Scan, Command Line and File Output)
ðŸ“– Summary: Ghoulbond is a Python-based open-source tool designed for system utility, scanning, and OSINT purposes. It provides functionalities such as gathering system information, retrieving IP and MAC addresses, scanning ports, extracting emails from websites, and performing geolocation lookups, making it a versatile tool for cybersecurity professionals and researchers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Chromium-Gost | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling secure connections using GOST cryptographic algorithms in the Chromium web browser.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Supports GOST cryptographic algorithms â€¢ Uses msspi interface for GOST support â€¢ Transparently switches to msspi when GOST is required â€¢ Available for Windows, Linux, and MacOS
ðŸ“– Summary: Chromium-Gost is a modified version of the Chromium browser that adds support for GOST cryptographic algorithms. It achieves this by utilizing the msspi interface when a website requests a GOST-based connection, seamlessly switching from the default BoringSSL library. This allows users in regions requiring GOST standards to access websites with enhanced security.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ bunster | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Compiling shell scripts into secure, portable, and standalone executables for environments without a shell.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Shell script compilation to static binaries â€¢ bash compatibility â€¢ Go transpilation â€¢ Module system (future) â€¢ Built-in package manager (future)
ðŸ“– Summary: Bunster is a shell compiler that transpiles bash scripts into Go source code and compiles them into static binaries. This allows shell scripts to be executed in environments where a shell is not available, enhancing security and portability. The project aims to provide modern language features to shell scripting, such as improved error handling, a module system, and static asset embedding.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
